page.title: 03The Fishing Industry.
page.content: Sidmouth was a fishing village before the original Domesday Book, but in the last 200 years the fishing industry has declined. There are 3 fishmarkets in our area; in the Ham, the Market Place and the new indoor market. A variety of fish are sold throughout the 3 markets, largely from{Beer,}but occasionally from{Brixham.}Monk fish and salmon are caught in the{Exe {estuary.}Only lobsters, crabs and mackerel are both caught and sold in Sidmouth. Advanced technology in the form of new fishing boats from Brixham and other ports has resulted in local fishermen finding it more profitable to charge tourists to go mackerel fishing and on trips around the bay.
